unnormalised: **Air Quality Dips in North Indian Cities Post Diwali, Experts Urge Caution**
normalised: Air Quality Dips in North Indian Cities Post Diwali, Experts Urge Caution

unnormalised: New Delhi – Air quality across several North Indian cities, including Delhi, Lucknow, and Kanpur, has deteriorated significantly following Diwali celebrations on November 12th, 2023. Data from the Central Pollution Control Board (CPCB) at 10:00 hrs today reveals a sharp spike in PM2.5 and PM10 levels, with some areas reporting "severe" air quality indices.
normalised: New Delhi – Air quality across several North Indian cities, including Delhi, Lucknow, and Kanpur, has deteriorated significantly following Diwali celebrations on twelfth November two thousand and twenty three. Data from the Central Pollution Control Board (C P C B) at ten zero zero hours today reveals a sharp spike in P M two point five and P M ten levels, with some areas reporting "severe" air quality indices.

unnormalised: "The bursting of firecrackers, coupled with unfavorable meteorological conditions like low wind speed, has contributed to this decline," explains Dr. Sharma from the Indian Institute of Tropical Meteorology (IITM), Pune. He adds that stubble burning in neighboring states like Punjab and Haryana also plays a role.

unnormalised: Children, the elderly, and those with respiratory ailments are particularly vulnerable. Health officials recommend staying indoors, using air purifiers, and wearing masks when venturing outside. The Delhi Government has already announced measures under GRAP (Graded Response Action Plan) Stage III, effective from 14/11/2023, including restrictions on construction and demolition activities. The long-term solution, as highlighted in numerous reports, lies in sustainable Diwali celebrations and addressing agricultural practices. Real-time air quality data can be accessed on the CPCB website. Let's all do our bit to breathe cleaner air.
